page.title: 03FARMING IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: Farming plays a large role in the life of this area. The villagers are surrounded by farms, some of which, have been handeds down from one generation to another. The Gop farm, a farm seeped in History, is the largest. This specialises in dairy cattle whilst adjacent farms specialise in sheep. Thew village milkman have their own herds of cattle, consequently milk deliveries take place at a later time than usual. There is a wide range of cereals grown and most of the farmers devote some of their land to potato production. Livestock is taken to the markets at St.Asaph, Abergele, and Mold.
